alert.note: Alert for Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 5:20PM CDT until June 22 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WASHITA...SOUTHEASTERN ROGER MILLS...SOUTHWESTERN CUSTER AND NORTHEASTERN BECKHAM COUNTIES... At 520 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Canute, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Elk City, Clinton, Cordell, Burns Flat, Arapaho, Hammon, Dill City, Canute, Bessie, Foss, Foss Reservoir, and Stafford. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
